intro: Sorengia petersonii, commonly known as Peterson's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, yellowish-green flowers clustered in umbels. Its leaves are usually simple and opposite, with a slightly hairy texture. Sorengia petersonii is characterized by its ability to thrive in arid environments, making it an important component of desert ecosystems.
